snippet: Government forces attacked rebel strongholds across the country while the main opposition group in exile, the Syrian National Council, chose a new Kurdish leader.
abstract: Syrian government forces shell rebel strongholds across the country, despite United Nations-brokered ceasefire and the presence of international monitors; amidst chaos, main opposition group in exile the Syrian National Council chooses Abdelbaset Sieda as new leader.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad and Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Government forces attacked rebel strongholds across the country while the main opposition group in exile, the Syrian National Council, chose a new Kurdish leader.

headline.main: Syrian Forces Shell Cities as Opposition Picks Leader
headline.print_headline: Syrian Forces Shell Cities As Opposition Picks Leader

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
